content: The gross profit margin, 53.4%, improved by 390 basis points compared to the prior year period of 49.5% driven by our continued higher level of full price sell-through, growing CPM revenues and a higher share of countries with prepaid duties charged to the customer, as for example, in the U.S. During the second quarter, marketing expenses increased to €23.8 million compared to €19.7 million in the prior year quarter, primarily due to the increase in the number of customers acquired.
